resources.string: A safe space for every mind âœ¨
ğŸ”’ Password must be 12+ characters with uppercase, lowercase, number, and symbol.
Your data is encrypted and secure
Enter the 6-digit code sent to your device
NeuroComet is a safe, affirming space for neurodivergent and LGBTQ+ minds. You belong here exactly as you areâ€”no masking required.
Tap the infinity symbol anytime to reduce visual motion. We designed this for sensory-friendly browsing.
Perfect! You\'ve activated calm mode. Tap again whenever you need more or less motion.
Choose themes designed for ADHD focus, autism comfort, anxiety relief, colorblind accessibility, and mood support. Your brain, your way.
12+ accessibility fonts including OpenDyslexic, Lexend, and Atkinson Hyperlegible. Adjust spacing, weight, and size to match how YOUR brain reads best.
Connect with people who get it. Neurodivergent, LGBTQ+, and alliesâ€”all brains, all identities, all beautiful. Special themes for Pride, Autism Day, and ADHD Month!
Content filtering, parental controls, screen time limits, and bedtime mode protect your wellbeing. You control what you see and when.
Sign in or create your account to join thousands of neurodivergent and LGBTQ+ individuals. This is YOUR spaceâ€”explore at your own pace.
Muted, calm colors to reduce stimulation
Bright, engaging colors for productive days
Warm, stimulating colors to boost mood
Cool, reassuring colors to ease worry
High contrast grayscale for complete color blindness
Optimized for TalkBack and screen readers with maximum contrast
Pure black/white for users with very low vision
Extra large text with simplified layout
Gentle colors that don\'t strain the eyes
Cheerful colors to match your mood
Celebrate your beautifully unique neurodivergent mind! ğŸŒˆğŸ§
When someone messages you, you\'ll see it here.
Start a new conversation from someone\'s profile! ğŸ’¬
When you message someone, it will show up here.
Tip: Try Explore â†’ tap a profile â†’ Message (mock).
Try a different search or switch back to All.
Direct Messages are disabled for kids mode (under 13). A parent can change this in Settings â†’ Safety & Parental Controls.
If something feels wrong, report abusive messages. Under-13 accounts canâ€™t use DMs.
Share your thoughts with the communityâ€¦
They wonâ€™t be able to message you, and this conversation will be hidden.
Theyâ€™ll be able to message you again.

Remove ads and support the developers.

Share a link with a preview
This will permanently delete this story. This action cannot be undone.

Premium upgrades are not wired in this demo build.
Posting has been disabled by parental controls. Ask a parent or guardian to change this setting.
This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to delete this post?
We\'re so glad you\'re here. This is a safe space designed for neurodivergent minds.
I totally agree with that! Great perspective.
\@%s mentioned you: \"Check out this accessibility tip!\"
%s shared your post about ADHD tips with %d followers
Remember to take breaks! You\'ve been active for a while. ğŸ’™
We\'ve hidden some content that may not be suitable. You can adjust this in settings.
ğŸŒˆ Just finished my rainbow puzzle! 1000 pieces completed! Who else loves puzzles? ğŸ§©
Today I learned that dinosaurs lived millions of years ago! ğŸ¦• T-Rex is my favorite!
My cat learned a new trick today! She can high-five now! ğŸ±âœ‹ So proud of her!
ğŸ® Just beat my high score in my favorite game! Practice really does make perfect! ğŸ†
ğŸŒˆ Made a friendship bracelet for my best friend! The colors are so pretty together! ğŸ’•
ğŸ• My dog is my best helper! He sits with me when I do homework and it makes me feel calm! ğŸ¾
ğŸ“– Reading time is the BEST! I\'m on chapter 10 of my favorite book series! Who else loves reading? ğŸ“š
ğŸ¨ Art class was so fun today! We painted sunsets and mine has ALL the colors! ğŸŒ…
Just had a breakthrough on my project! Hyperfocus is a superpower when you can direct it. Late night coding sessions hit different.
Trying out my new weighted vest today. Instant calm, highly recommend for sensory regulation! Also helps with my anxiety during exams.
Dating with ADHD is wild. Hyperfocusing on someone new then completely forgetting to text back for 3 days ğŸ˜… Anyone else?
School stress is real right now. Midterms + social anxiety = wanting to hide in my room for a week. At least my noise-canceling headphones help.
Need a quiet space. Going into Overload Mode for the rest of the afternoon. See you all tomorrow. #QuietMode
Just finished sorting all my project files into categorized folders. The visual order is immensely satisfying. My therapist says this is a healthy coping mechanism.
Workplace accommodations are finally in place! Took 6 months of advocacy but got my quiet workspace approved. HR was surprisingly supportive once I provided the documentation.
Adulting with ADHD: Forgot to pay rent again, but somehow remembered every line of dialogue from a movie I watched 10 years ago. My landlord is not amused.

PSA: Getting diagnosed as an adult is valid. Got mine at 34 and suddenly my entire life makes sense. The grief of \'what could have been\' is real but so is the relief of finally understanding yourself.
Hey! Love your posts about sensory tips! ğŸ’œ
Thanks so much! Your content is super helpful too!
Quick question about that fidget toy you recommended?
Sure, happy to help! What would you like to know?
âœ¨ Finally got my sensory-friendly workspace set up! Noise-canceling headphones, soft lighting, and my weighted lap pad. Game changer for focus! ğŸ§ğŸ’¡
Reminder: Your brain works differently, not wrong. ğŸ§ ğŸ’œ Embrace your unique way of processing the world!
Just discovered body doubling on NeuroComet and WOW. Studied for 3 hours straight with my virtual study buddy! ğŸ“šğŸ‰ Anyone else find this helpful?
My stim toy collection is growing! ğŸŒˆ These fidget tools have helped me so much in meetings. No shame in stimming! âœ¨
Pro tip: Create a \'launch pad\' by your door with everything you need for the day. Keys, wallet, meds, snacks - all in one spot! ğŸš€ ADHD life hack #247
Today\'s win: I remembered to eat lunch! ğŸŠ Setting phone alarms for basic needs is self-care. Don\'t let anyone tell you otherwise. ğŸ’ª
Hey, how are you feeling today?
Did you see that new scam post? Don\'t fall for it!
Thanks for the warning. I saw the phishing attempt.
Hey! I saw your post about executive function struggles. I totally relate!
Right?! Some days are just harder than others.
Have you tried body doubling? It really helps me stay on task.
I\'ve heard of it but never tried. How does it work for you?
I just video call a friend while we both work on our own stuff. The accountability helps!
Yo! That productivity hack you shared was ğŸ”¥
Glad it helped! The Pomodoro technique is a game changer.
I modified it to 25 min work / 10 min stim break. Works way better for my ADHD brain.
That\'s genius! Mind if I share that tip in my next post?
Go for it! Tag me ğŸ˜„
ğŸ¨ Just finished a new painting during my hyperfocus session!
OMG I need to see it! You\'re so talented!
Thanks! It\'s all blues and purples - very calming colors. I\'ll post it later today.
Those are my favorite colors too! They really help when I\'m overstimulated.
Hi there! Wanted to share a grounding technique that helped me today.
I\'m all ears! Been having a rough week with anxiety.
Try the 5-4-3-2-1 method: 5 things you see, 4 you hear, 3 you touch, 2 you smell, 1 you taste.
This is really helpful, thank you! ğŸ’™
Anytime! We\'re all in this together. ğŸ¤—
Just got the new mechanical keyboard! The clicks are SO satisfying ğŸ¹
Ooooh which switches did you get?
Cherry MX Blues! The tactile feedback is *chef\'s kiss* for my stimming needs.
I\'ve been eyeing those! Do they help you focus while coding?
Absolutely! The rhythmic clicking is like a built-in focus soundtrack. Highly recommend!
Adding to cart right now ğŸ˜‚
Low spoon day today ğŸ˜´ How are you managing?
Same here. Decided to cancel all non-essential plans.
That\'s smart! Self-care isn\'t selfish. Rest up! ğŸ’œ

Icon applied! Restart your launcher if it doesn\'t update. ğŸ¨

Tap the â™¾ï¸ infinity logo on the login screen to quickly enable/disable animations
Tap the version info 7 times in Settings to unlock the secret Rainbow Brain theme!
Enable Dark Mode + Autism Low Stimulation theme for the calmest experience
Try Lexend or Atkinson Hyperlegible fonts - designed for neurodivergent readers
Disable all animations in Settings > Animations and use the Calm or Overload theme
Use ADHD Task Mode theme + Hyperfocus for minimal distractions
Set up Parental Controls with a PIN to manage screen time and content
The logo automatically celebrates holidays and ND awareness events with special colors!
Explore themes for ADHD, Autism, Anxiety, Colorblind, Low Vision, and your current mood
Choose from dyslexia-friendly, ADHD-friendly, and accessibility fonts in Settings > Font & Reading
Watch the getting started guide again
Unlock stim-friendly games by earning achievements
This game is still being developed. Check back soon!
Pop satisfying bubbles for a calming stim experience
Tap the bubbles to pop them! âœ¨
Spin to your heart\'s content - no limits, just vibes
Swipe to spin! The faster you swipe, the faster it goes ğŸŒ€
Watch relaxing color gradients flow and mix
Tap anywhere to change the colors
Tap patterns in sequence - great for focus training
Draw endless patterns that never fade - pure stim bliss
Watch beautiful raindrops fall with soothing visuals
Follow the bubble to practice calm breathing
Breathe in as the bubble grows, out as it shrinks ğŸ«§
Tap tiles to feel different satisfying textures
Each tile has unique haptic feedback - find your favorites!
Create ambient soundscapes by planting sound flowers
Tap to plant, long-press to remove. Layer sounds together! ğŸŒ¸
Create your own satisfying rhythm patterns
Tap pads to build your beat! Long-press to clear ğŸµ
Grow flowers that represent your feelings
Tap to plant an emotion flower, watch it grow! ğŸŒ¸
Design your own calming virtual room
Add items to create your perfect calm space ğŸ
Write worries and watch them float away
Type a worry and release it to the jar âœ¨
Draw lines between stars to create constellations
Connect the stars to reveal patterns â­
Draw calming patterns in virtual sand
Trace your finger to create ripples ğŸï¸
Blend colors to match your current mood
Drag colors together to create new feelings ğŸ¨
Check out the %s community on NeuroComet! ğŸ§ âœ¨
Learn the basics and community guidelines
ADHD, Autism, Anxiety, Colorblind, and Mood themes
Disable animations for a calmer experience
Special themes for ND awareness days
Screen time, bedtime mode, content filtering

Books and articles recommended by members
ğŸ§ Just discovered the power of body doubling! Working alongside someone (even virtually) helps me stay on task so much better.
Anyone else use timers for EVERYTHING? I set 25-min work blocks and it\'s a game changer. Pomodoro for the win! ğŸ…
TIP: Put your phone in another room during deep work. Out of sight = out of mind. Finally finishing projects!
External scaffolding is my superpower! Visual reminders, apps, alarms - my environment remembers so I don\'t have to ğŸ“
Started using \'implementation intentions\' - instead of \'I\'ll exercise\' I say \'At 7am, I put on shoes and walk\'. Works! ğŸƒâ€â™€ï¸
Found a new safe food! These rice crackers have the perfect crunch without being too loud. Sharing the brand in comments ğŸ˜
Reminder that \'safe foods\' are valid! Sometimes plain pasta is self-care. No shame in eating what works for you ğŸ
I made a sensory-friendly recipe book! All recipes avoid common texture triggers. Would anyone want me to share it?
Does anyone else have \'safe restaurants\'? Places where you know exactly what to order and it\'s always consistent?
Batch cooking my safe foods on Sunday = less decision fatigue all week! Currently rotating 5 meals I actually enjoy ğŸ’ª
Finally found a weighted blanket that doesn\'t make me overheat! Deep pressure + cool fabric = actually sleeping ğŸ˜´
Wind-down routine that works for my brain: dim lights, no screens 1hr before, same playlist every night. Consistency is key!
Anyone else\'s brain do the \'remember every embarrassing moment\' thing at 2am? Started journaling before bed to \'close tabs\'
White noise vs brown noise vs pink noise - which works for you? I\'m team brown noise, it\'s like a hug for my ears ğŸ”Š
Started using blackout curtains AND a sleep mask. Totally dark room = finally getting deep sleep cycles!
New stim toy review! This textured fidget ring is SO satisfying. Quiet enough for meetings, stimmy enough for regulation âœ¨
Normalize stimming in public! I was rocking at the grocery store and a kid said \'she\'s dancing!\' Made my day ğŸ’ƒ
For my fellow oral stimmers - found chewable necklaces that look like actual jewelry. Discreet AND functional!
Movement is medicine! When I can\'t stim openly, I do toe-tapping under my desk. Subtle but still helps ğŸ¦¶
Built a \'stim kit\' for my bag: putty, textured cards, fidget cube. Always prepared for regulation needs!
Loop earplugs CHANGED MY LIFE. Still hear conversations but takes the edge off sensory-overload environments ğŸ§
Warm-toned light bulbs + dimmer switches made my home a safe haven. Harsh fluorescents are banned!
Spent an hour removing all clothing tags today. Worth every second. Why do brands make them so scratchy?! ğŸ‘•
Unscented everything is the way. Made a list of truly fragrance-free products, happy to share!
Created a \'sensory map\' of my city - quiet cafes, low-stim stores, accessible escape routes. Super helpful! ğŸ—ºï¸
Reminder: Meltdowns aren\'t \'bad behavior\' - they\'re nervous system overload. Be gentle with yourself after ğŸ’™
My meltdown kit: noise-canceling headphones, sunglasses, weighted lap pad, water, and a \'safe person\' contact
Learning my warning signs: irritability spike, sound sensitivity increase, physical tension. Catching it early helps!
Created a \'calm corner\' in my home with dim lights, soft textures, and NO demands. Essential recovery zone ğŸ
Post-meltdown self-care: rest, hydration, comfort food, and absolutely NO self-criticism. Recovery takes time ğŸŒ¸
Scripts for small talk! \'How\'s your day going?\' â†’ \'Any fun weekend plans?\' â†’ \'That sounds nice!\' Memorized patterns help! ğŸ’¬
Quality over quantity. Having 2-3 close friends who \'get it\' is worth more than 100 acquaintances ğŸ‘¥
It\'s okay to leave social events early! \'I had a great time, heading out now\' - no long explanation needed ğŸ‘‹
\'I need to think about that\' is a complete sentence. No pressure to respond immediately!
Parallel play is valid adult friendship! Gaming together, crafting in the same room - connection without constant interaction
Finally dropping the mask at home. It\'s exhausting pretending to be \'normal\' all day. Safe spaces matter ğŸ­
Masking led to burnout. Now I\'m slowly learning who I am without the performance. It\'s scary but freeing
Found friends who accept the real me - stims, infodumps, and all. They say I\'m \'more interesting\' unmasked! âœ¨
The price of masking: migraines, fatigue, identity confusion. Is \'fitting in\' worth my wellbeing? Reconsideringâ€¦
Started stimming publicly. Heart raced at first, but literally no one cared. The fear was bigger than reality ğŸ’ª
Three hours researching dinosaur feather evolution and I regret NOTHING! Who wants to hear about Archaeopteryx? ğŸ¦•
My special interest is train schedules. I can tell you every stop on 47 metro lines. Ask me anything! ğŸš‚
Fungi are INCREDIBLE. Did you know there\'s a mushroom that can break down plastic? Mycelium is the future! ğŸ„
When your special interest has lore, you BECOME the wiki. 400 hours in this game and still learning! ğŸ®
Space facts incoming! A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus. Mind = blown every time I think about it âœ¨
ADHD + anxiety is a rough combo. Tips that help me: structured routines, movement breaks, and lots of self-compassion ğŸ§˜
Some days, just existing is an achievement. Be proud of the small wins. You\'re doing better than you think ğŸ’™
Finally found a neurodivergent-affirming therapist! They understand that \'just try harder\' isn\'t helpful. Game changer!
Journaling prompts for rough days: What\'s draining me? What\'s one kind thing I can do for myself right now?
Medication isn\'t a failure - it\'s a tool. Just like glasses for vision. No shame in chemical support ğŸ’Š
Got my workplace accommodations approved! Noise-canceling headphones, flexible hours, written instructions. Know your rights! ğŸ’¼
College disability services changed everything. Extra time, quiet testing rooms, note-taking support. Ask for help! ğŸ“
WFH is my dream. No fluorescent lights, no open offices, no surprise social interactions. Productivity skyrocketed!
Cameras off in meetings when I need them. Standing during calls. These \'small\' accommodations make huge differences
Neurodivergent-friendly career paths: programming, research, art, writing, data analysis. Play to your strengths! ğŸ“ˆ
Diagnosed at 35. Everything suddenly makes sense - the struggles, the differences, the \'quirks\'. Grief and relief mixed ğŸ”
Spent decades thinking I was broken. Turns out I\'m just wired differently. Late diagnosis is still valid diagnosis ğŸ’œ
Unmasking after 40 years is HARD. Who am I without the performance? Slowly rediscovering myself
Grieving the support I could have had growing up. But also grateful for finally understanding myself ğŸŒ±
It\'s never too late to learn about yourself. Late-diagnosed at 52, and life is finally making sense!
The overlap between LGBTQ+ and ND communities is SO real! Finding people who understand BOTH identities is everything ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆâ™¾ï¸
Happy to be queer AND neurodivergent! Both are part of who I am, and both are valid and beautiful âœ¨
Research shows ND folks are more likely to be LGBTQ+. We break the mold in so many ways! ğŸ’œ
This space accepting ALL of me without questions is healing. Thank you for being here ğŸ™
Whether you\'re figuring out identity, already out, or just supporting - you belong here! ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ
Being trans AND autistic means processing identity on multiple levels. It\'s complex but beautiful ğŸ³ï¸â€âš§ï¸
ND brains often experience gender differently. Our journeys are valid even if they\'re not \'typical\' ğŸ’™ğŸ’—ğŸ¤
Name and pronoun stickers in my profile! Respect is non-negotiable here ğŸ³ï¸â€âš§ï¸
Navigating healthcare as trans AND ND can be extra challenging. Let\'s share resources and support! ğŸ’ª
Finally living as my true self. The ND community has been incredibly welcoming. Grateful ğŸ’œ
Pride month may be June, but we celebrate ALL year! Queer joy is ND-friendly joy ğŸŒˆâœ¨
Sensory-friendly pride events are the BEST. Pride with ear plugs and sunglasses! ğŸ‰ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ
Remember: you don\'t need to \'prove\' your identity to anyone. Your experience is valid! ğŸ’–
Celebrating queer joy today! What makes you happy about being part of this community? ğŸŠ
Learning LGBTQ+ history has been my special interest this month. So much to celebrate and honor! ğŸ“šğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ
Asexual AND autistic - the \'double A\' club! Understanding both has been a journey of self-discovery ğŸ–¤ğŸ¤ğŸ’œ
Aromantic spectrum representation matters! QPRs, chosen families, and friendship-centered lives are beautiful ğŸ’š
Gray-ace, demi, aego - so many ways to experience (or not experience) attraction. All valid! ğŸ–¤ğŸ©¶ğŸ¤ğŸ’œ
Not experiencing attraction the \'typical\' way doesn\'t make us broken. Different is just different ğŸ’œ
Ace week resources coming up! Educational content and community stories to share ğŸ–¤ğŸ©¶ğŸ¤ğŸ’œ
Non-binary and neurodivergent! Gender is a construct I\'m happily deconstructing ğŸ’›ğŸ¤ğŸ’œğŸ–¤
They/them pronouns please! Our community respects everyone\'s identity ğŸ’œ
Some days more femme, some days more masc, some days ??? And all of it is valid! âœ¨
Finding gender-affirming clothing that\'s also sensory-friendly is an adventure! Share your finds! ğŸ‘•
It took me years to understand my gender. ND brain + gender exploration = complex but worth it ğŸ’›ğŸ¤ğŸ’œğŸ–¤
Coming out as both ND and queer to my family was terrifying but freeing. You do it on YOUR timeline! ğŸšªğŸ’œ
This community is a safe space to explore. You don\'t have to have all the answers yet ğŸ’™
Sharing coming out stories helps others feel less alone. Comment yours if you\'re comfortable! ğŸŒˆ
Not sure about labels yet and that\'s okay! Questioning is part of the journey, not the end ğŸ’œ
Chosen family when bio family doesn\'t understand. The ND+LGBTQ+ community has your back ğŸ ğŸ’œ
Welcome to this community! Share your experiences and support each other. We\'re all in this together ğŸ’™
Remember: everyone\'s journey is different. What works for one person might not work for another, and that\'s okay!
Great resources in the pinned post! Check them out if you\'re new here ğŸ“š
This is a judgment-free zone. Ask questions, share struggles, celebrate wins. We\'ve got you! ğŸŒŸ
New members: introduce yourself! What brings you here? What do you hope to learn or share?
These topics bring them joy - ask about them!
